dmzdemilitarizedzone.eli5: A DMZ is like a waiting room between the internet and your private network—visitors can come in, but not too far.
dmzdemilitarizedzone.boss: A DMZ (Demilitarized Zone) is a network area that separates public-facing services from your internal network for security.
dmzdemilitarizedzone.sysadmin: DMZs isolate exposed services (e.g., web, mail servers) from internal networks using firewalls to limit potential compromise.
dmzdemilitarizedzone.use_case: Used to host a web server that’s accessible from the internet but isolated from internal devices.

qosqualityofservice.eli5: QoS is like giving VIP tickets to important data so it gets there faster.
qosqualityofservice.boss: QoS (Quality of Service) prioritizes certain network traffic to ensure critical services perform well even during congestion.
qosqualityofservice.sysadmin: QoS marks packets with DSCP/CoS, controls bandwidth with shaping and queuing, and ensures low-latency for VoIP or streaming.
qosqualityofservice.use_case: Used to prioritize video calls over file downloads on a business network.

mtumaximumtransmissionunit.eli5: MTU is the biggest box of data your network can carry without breaking it up.
mtumaximumtransmissionunit.boss: MTU defines the largest packet size a network can handle before needing to split it, affecting performance and reliability.
mtumaximumtransmissionunit.sysadmin: MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit) affects packet fragmentation—set per interface, common values are 1500 for Ethernet.
mtumaximumtransmissionunit.use_case: Used to troubleshoot VPN slowness by adjusting MTU to avoid packet fragmentation.
